Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Tanzania 
   Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's famous work "Let Us Give Fuller Play to the Advantages of Our People's Power" was brought out in booklet by the Publishing House of Dar Es Salaam University in Tanzania on Aug. 22.
 The work, published on Dec. 21, Juche 81 (1992), clarifies the matters related to the solidity and vitality of the people's power and issues of increasing its function and role and firmly adhering to the fundamental principle governing its construction and improving and strengthening the work of the people's power organs.

articles.content:
Greetings to Malaysian King 
   Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a message of greetings to Tuanku Syed Sirajuddin Ibni Al-Marhum Tuanku Syed Putra Jamalullail, king of Malaysia, on the 49th national day of the country.
 Expressing the belief that the excellent friendly and cooperative ties between the two countries would develop further still in various fields in mutual interests, the message wholeheartedly wished the friendly Malaysian people prosperity and welfare.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Trinidad and Tobago
Independence, Life and Soul of Social Being
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Trinidad and Tobago
   Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a message of greetings to George Maxwell Richard, president of Trinidad and Tobago, on the 44th anniversary of its independence.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly ties between the two countries would continue to develop favorably, the message sincerely wished the president greater successes in his work for the country's prosperity and people's welfare.

articles.content:
Greetings to Prime Minister of Malaysia
   Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Datuk Seri Abdullah Ahmad Badawi, prime minister of Malaysia, on the occasion of its 49th national day.
 The message wholeheartedly wished the prime minister success in his work, expressing the belief that the relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger in various fields.

articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il
   Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the Vietnamese government economic delegation on a visit to the DPRK.
 The gift was handed to an official concerned by Phan The Rue, permanent vice-minister of Trade, who is heading the delegation.
